text: Canarium fuscocalycinum is a tree of Borneo in the incense tree family Burseraceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Latin meaning "dark calyx". ==Description== Canarium fuscocalycinum grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . Its twigs are rusty brown. The ellipsoid fruits measure up to . ==Distribution and habitat== Canarium fuscocalycinum is endemic to Borneo where it is confined to Sarawak. Its habitat is lowland mixed dipterocarp forests. ==References== fuscocalycinum Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Flora of Sarawak Category:Plants described in 1930 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Canarium fuscocalycinum
